new_p_2389: The mortgage is the largest financial commitment for most households in Israel. Incorrect planning can cost you dearly. In this guide, we'll reveal the secrets to building a smart mix, conducting effective negotiations, and properly using mortgage advisory services.
new_p_2391: When we approach taking a mortgage, we face a strong and experienced financial entity – the bank. The bank's goal, like any economic business, is to maximize its profits. In contrast, the borrower's interest is to minimize costs and the total final repayment to the bank. This gap creates an inherent conflict of interest. Without professional knowledge or guidance from objective mortgage advisory, the average borrower struggles to understand the small nuances that make a big difference.
new_p_2392: A common mistake is focusing solely on the initial monthly repayment amount. Banks may offer tracks with low initial repayments, but ones that are linked to the Consumer Price Index or at variable interest rates that could spike in the future. The result is a mortgage that looks cheap initially but becomes very expensive over the years, sometimes with a difference of hundreds of thousands of shekels.
new_p_2395: The biggest secret is not just the interest rate, but the composition of tracks (the mix). The right combination between fixed, variable, linked and unlinked tracks is the key to stability. A personally tailored mix will protect you from sharp index increases and allow flexibility for future changes without heavy exit penalties.
new_p_2397: The bank is a business, and interest rates are the product price. Like in any market, it's possible and advisable to negotiate. After building the right mix, you should submit it to several banks and conduct a pricing round. An experienced mortgage advisor knows exactly how low the bank can go and can secure conditions for you that a private client would struggle to achieve alone.
new_p_2399: The mortgage is dynamic. What's right today won't necessarily be right in 5 years. Shortening the mortgage period by a few years can save tens of thousands of shekels in interest payments. You should plan future exit points and refinancing according to the family's expected income projections.
new_p_2401: For young couples, mortgage advisory for a first home is particularly critical. Usually, this is the first major transaction of their lives, and lack of experience can lead to costly mistakes. It's important to understand the real repayment capacity, take into account associated expenses (such as appraisals, lawyer fees, and construction input index) and build a plan that will allow the family to grow financially and not suffocate under the burden of payments.
new_p_2402: Even when it comes to mortgage advisory for home upgraders, the complexity doesn't decrease. Here additional elements come into play such as transferring an existing mortgage, bridge loans until selling the old property, and synchronizing between payment and receipt dates. Poor planning at this stage can lead to severe cash flow problems and unnecessary interest payments on transition loans.
new_p_2403: Even if you've already taken a mortgage before, it doesn't mean you're "stuck" with it forever. The mortgage market changes constantly. A process of mortgage refinancing and improving conditions allows you to replace the old mortgage with a new one, under better terms. This is especially worthwhile when interest rates in the economy drop, when your income increases and you can increase the monthly repayment to shorten the period, or when you receive a lump sum (like a training fund) and want to pay off part of the debt.
new_p_2405: Never sign a mortgage under time pressure. Banks tend to limit the validity of interest rates to 24 days, but proper advance planning will prevent you from needing to make hasty decisions at the last minute.
new_p_2407: Don't remain in doubt. Our professional team will be happy to review your mortgage data and build a personalized savings plan for you.
new_p_2460: One of the most significant factors in mortgage appreciation over the years is the index. Understanding this mechanism is critical for anyone planning to take a mortgage or in the process of mortgage consultation.
new_p_2463: The Consumer Price Index is a statistical figure published by the Central Bureau of Statistics (CBS) on the 15th of each month. The index reflects the change in cost of a fixed "basket of products" consumed by the average Israeli family. The basket includes food, housing, transportation, education, health and more. When the prices of products in the basket rise, the index rises – this phenomenon is called inflation.
new_p_2464: In the mortgage field, the index plays a crucial role in tracks that are "index-linked". When you take a loan in a linked track, your balance and monthly payment are updated according to changes in this index. Therefore, when seeking mortgage consultation, one of the first issues examined is the borrowers' exposure to index changes and the associated risk.
new_p_2467: Many mistakenly think that the index only affects the interest rate, but the most devastating impact is on the principal (original debt amount). If you took 500,000 NIS in an index-linked track, and the index rose by 3% in a year, your debt grew nominally by 15,000 NIS, even before calculating the interest. This is a situation where borrowers pay for many years but the debt hardly decreases.
new_p_2469: When the principal balance rises following the index, the bank spreads the new and higher balance over the remaining loan years. The direct result is an increase in the monthly payment. In long-term mortgages, cumulative index increases can raise the monthly payment by hundreds or even thousands of shekels over the life of the mortgage.
new_p_2471: Suppose you took a mortgage of one million NIS, of which 500,000 NIS is in an index-linked track. If the annual inflation is 2.5%, after just one year, your debt in this track will grow by 12,500 NIS. This means that even if you paid monthly payments for a year, your total debt balance may remain the same or even grow.
new_p_2473: Despite the risks, index-linked tracks have one distinct advantage: their initial interest rate is significantly lower than non-linked tracks. This allows reducing the initial monthly payment, which is especially critical for young couples in the process of first-time home mortgage consultation, whose current available income is low but expected to rise in the future.
new_p_2474: The wisdom lies in building the mix. An experienced mortgage advisor will know how to combine linked tracks for relatively short periods, or with exit stations that allow early repayment without significant penalties. The goal is to enjoy the currently low interest rate, but neutralize the index risk in the long term.
new_p_2480: Don't put all your eggs in one basket. Combine a prime track (not index-linked) and fixed non-linked tracks to ensure stability in monthly payment.
new_p_2482: If you chose an index-linked track, try to take it for as short a period as possible. The shorter the period, the faster the principal repayment rate compared to the index impact.
new_p_2484: Conduct periodic mortgage reviews. If the index starts to run wild, it may be worth refinancing the mortgage and switching to more solid tracks, even at the cost of slightly higher interest.
new_p_2486: Our team specializes in building mortgage mixes personally tailored to your repayment capabilities and market forecasts. Don't let inflation manage your mortgage.
new_p_2540: Purchasing an apartment "on paper" or at various construction stages is fundamentally different from buying a second-hand apartment. Discover how to properly manage payment flow, avoid costly mistakes, and save tens of thousands of shekels in the process.
new_p_2542: Purchasing an apartment from a contractor is one of the most common and complex transactions in the Israeli real estate market. Unlike buying a second-hand apartment, where you transfer payment and receive keys within a short time, purchasing from a contractor spans a long period – sometimes two or even three years.
new_p_2543: This process requires dedicated and personalized mortgage consulting. The borrower must make critical decisions regarding the timing of fund withdrawals: Should you pay the contractor as early as possible to avoid construction input index increases? Or is it better to keep the money in the bank and avoid paying mortgage interest at an early stage?
new_p_2544: Whether it's a first-time home mortgage consultation process for young couples, or home upgraders selling an existing property, dealing with the contractor and bank requires a clear strategy.
new_p_2547: The balance not yet paid to the contractor is usually linked to the construction input index. When the index rises, your debt to the contractor automatically increases. Sometimes, this price increase can reach tens of thousands of shekels per year, making early payments (through the mortgage) an economically profitable move.
new_p_2549: Many apartment buyers from contractors still live in rental properties while the building is being constructed. Starting full mortgage payments alongside rent payments creates a heavy cash flow burden. The solution is usually a "Grace mortgage" – paying interest only during the interim period.
new_p_2551: Since the mortgage is drawn in installments (according to construction progress), interest rates on parts not yet drawn may change (if not predetermined). Proper management of "anchors" and tracks ensures you won't be surprised by sharp interest rate increases mid-construction.
new_p_2553: One of the central questions in mortgage consulting for contractor apartment buyers is the order of operations. Usually, banks require the buyer to pay their equity before starting to withdraw mortgage funds. However, there are cases where it's possible and advisable to request exceptional approval to advance mortgage funds, especially in high inflation environments with rising construction input indices.
new_p_2560: For clients undergoing mortgage consultation for home upgrading, the situation is even more complex. Sometimes the money for purchasing the new apartment depends on selling the old one. In such cases, solutions like "bridge loans" (balloon) against the existing apartment can be used to pay the contractor on time and save on the index, even before the old apartment is sold.
new_p_2562: Many mistakenly think that a mortgage is just about "interest rates." In contractor purchases, "planning" is no less important than "price." A mistake in fund withdrawal timing can cost more than any tenth of a percent difference in interest rates.
new_p_2563: A professional mortgage consultation process takes into account all variables: expected construction completion, current versus future repayment capacity, expected indices, and regulatory changes. Our goal is to build a "financial suit" that will allow you to go through the construction period with peace of mind and reach key handover with a stable and economical mortgage.
new_p_2564: Don't leave your money to chance. Early planning is the key to significant savings.

services_h3_9: From first home to mortgage refinancing - we're here for you at every step
services_p_17: Buying your first home is one of the most significant and exciting steps in life. We understand that the process can seem complex and intimidating, which is why we offer comprehensive first home mortgage consulting that accompanies you from start to finish.
services_p_18: Our service includes a detailed explanation of all available mortgage types, checking your eligibility for mortgages and government benefits, and managing interest rate tenders between different banks. We'll help you understand all required documents and accompany you to every bank meeting.
services_p_19: As part of our mortgage consulting, we'll build a detailed financial plan for you that shows exactly how much you can afford, what the expected monthly payment will be, and how the mortgage will affect your financial situation over the years. Our goal is to ensure you start life in your new home with peace of mind and financial security.
services_p_20: If you already have a mortgage, you might be paying too much! The mortgage market is constantly changing, and interest rates that were competitive a few years ago may be too high today. Mortgage refinancing and terms improvement can save you thousands of shekels per year.
services_p_21: We specialize in comprehensive review of your existing mortgage and identifying savings opportunities. We'll examine the interest rate you're currently paying, your mortgage terms, and various options for improvement. Then, we'll approach all relevant banks and financial institutions to find you the best offer.
services_p_22: The mortgage refinancing process also includes checking early fees, calculating expected long-term savings, and ensuring the switch is truly worthwhile. We'll handle all the small details and ensure the process runs smoothly without unpleasant surprises. Our mortgage consulting guarantees you'll receive the best possible terms.
services_p_23: The family is growing and it's time to move to a larger home? Housing upgrade is a significant step that requires careful financial planning. We provide mortgage consulting for housing upgraders that takes into account your existing mortgage and finds the optimal solution for the move.
services_p_24: As part of our mortgage consulting, we'll examine your current mortgage, assess the value of your existing property, and check various options for financing the new apartment. Should you sell the current apartment first? Is it better to keep it and rent it out? We'll help you make the right decision according to your financial situation and goals.
services_p_25: We'll also coordinate between selling the old property and purchasing the new one, check options for bridge mortgage if needed, and ensure the transition is smooth without excessive financial pressure. Our goal is to help you upgrade your housing while maintaining financial stability and minimizing risks.
services_p_26: Every person is unique, and so are their financial needs. We believe there's no one-size-fits-all solution, which is why we offer precise and personalized mortgage matching services. We'll build a mortgage that fits exactly your needs, your financial situation, and your future plans.
services_p_27: The process begins with an in-depth introductory meeting where we learn about your financial situation, income and expenses, future plans, and financial goals. Based on this information, we build a personalized mortgage plan that takes into account all relevant parameters.
services_p_28: We examine different types of mortgages - fixed, variable, or combined interest rate mortgages, index-linked or non-linked mortgages, and more. We'll explain the advantages and disadvantages of each option and recommend the optimal combination for you. Our mortgage consulting ensures you receive a solution that fits you exactly.
services_p_29: Proper management of family finances is the key to financial stability and achieving long-term financial goals. We offer comprehensive financial consulting that helps you manage your family budget smartly and efficiently.
services_p_30: We'll start by building a complete picture of your financial situation - income, fixed and variable expenses, debts and financial obligations. We'll identify savings opportunities and build a customized budget plan that will help you achieve your financial goals.
services_p_31: The service also includes consulting on topics such as long-term savings, building an emergency fund, retirement planning, and more. We'll help you understand where your money goes and how to manage it better. The goal is to give you complete control over your finances and ensure a secure financial future for your family.
services_p_32: Your pension portfolio is one of your most important assets, and it will significantly impact your quality of life in retirement. Despite this, many of us don't know what's in our pension portfolio or if it's managed optimally.
services_p_33: We offer comprehensive pension portfolio review services. We'll check the funds and tracks you're investing in, examine their performance over time, and compare them to market alternatives. We'll also check the fees you're paying and ensure they're reasonable.
services_p_34: Based on the review, we'll provide professional recommendations for improving your pension portfolio. This may include transferring to better-performing funds, changing investment tracks, reducing fees, and more. The goal is to maximize returns on your pension savings and ensure you have a comfortable and dignified retirement.
